column1: So he departed with his only friends—his horse and his faithful dog Cabriole; while all who met him looked at him compassionately
column2: pitying so pretty a youth bound on such a hopeless errand. But
column4: Avenant rode on and answered nothing
column5: for he was too sad at heart.He reached a mountain-side
column6: where he sat down to rest
column8: and Cabriole to run after the flies. He knew that the Grotto of Darkness was not far off
column9: yet he looked about him like one who sees nothing. At last he perceived a rock
column11: whence came a thick smoke; and in a moment appeared one of the two dragons
column12: breathing out flames. It had a yellow and green body
column14: and a long tail. When Cabriole saw the monster
column15: the poor little dog hid himself in terrible fright. But Avenant resolved to die bravely; so
column16: taking a phial which the princess had given him
column17: he prepared to descend into the cave.
